remoteJobId.description: The process or local job id of the job on the remote execution system.
remoteJobId.name: remoteJobId

memoryPerNode.description: The requested memory for this application to run given in GB.
memoryPerNode.name: memoryPerNode

archiveSystem.description: The unique id of the storage system on which this job's output will be staged.
archiveSystem.name: archiveSystem

processorsPerNode.description: The number of processors this application should utilize while running. If the application is not of executionType PARALLEL, this should be 1.
processorsPerNode.name: processorsPerNode

message.description: The error message incurred when the job failed.
message.name: message

id.description: The unique id of the job.
id.name: id

parameters.description: The application specific parameters needed for this job. These vary from application to application and should be entered as multiple individual parameters in the form. The actual dataType will be determined by the application description.
parameters.name: parameters

archivePath.description: The path of the archive folder for this job on the user's default storage sytem.
archivePath.name: archivePath

archive.description: Whether the output from this job should be archived. If true, all new files created by this application's execution will be archived to the archivePath in the user's default storage system.
archive.name: archive

outputPath.description: Relative path of the job's output data.
outputPath.name: outputPath

maxHours.description: The requested compute time needed for this application to complete given in HH:mm:ss format.
maxHours.name: maxHours

status.description: The status of the job. Possible values are: PENDING, STAGING_INPUTS, CLEANING_UP, ARCHIVING, STAGING_JOB, FINISHED, KILLED, FAILED, STOPPED, RUNNING, PAUSED, QUEUED, SUBMITTING, STAGED, PROCESSING_INPUTS, ARCHIVING_FINISHED, ARCHIVING_FAILED
status.name: status

inputs.description: The application specific input files needed for this job. These vary from application to application and should be entered as multiple individual parameters in the form. Inputs may be given as relative paths in the user's default storage system or as URI. If a URI is given, the data will be staged in by the IO service and made avaialble to the application at run time.
inputs.name: inputs

remoteSubmitted.description: The date the job was submitted in ISO 8601 format.
remoteSubmitted.name: remoteSubmitted

notifications.description: An array of notifications you wish to receive.
notifications.name: notifications

systemId.description: The system id of the execution system.
systemId.name: systemId

started.description: The date the job started in ISO 8601 format.
started.name: started

appId.description: The unique name of the application being run by this job. This must be a valid application that the calling user has permission to run.
appId.name: appId

nodeCount.description: The number of processors this application should utilize while running. If the application is not of executionType PARALLEL, this should be 1.
nodeCount.name: nodeCount

submitRetries.description: The number of retires it took to submit this job.
submitRetries.name: submitRetries

failedStatusCheck.description: Number of failed times the remote system was queried for job status.
failedStatusCheck.name: failedStatusCheck

lastStatusCheck.description: Last time a status check was attempted.
lastStatusCheck.name: lastStatusCheck

lastStatusMessage.description: Last message logged for this job.
lastStatusMessage.name: lastStatusMessage

remoteEnded.description: Time job finished running on remote system.
remoteEnded.name: remoteEnded

remoteOutcome.description: Best approximation of remote jobâ€™s outcome: FINISHED, FAILED, FAILED_SKIP_ARCHIVE
remoteOutcome.name: remoteOutcome

remoteStatusChecks.description: Number of successful times the remote system was queried for job status.
remoteStatusChecks.name: remoteStatusChecks

roles.description: Roles assigned by authentication server to owner (comma-separated).
roles.name: roles

schedulerJobId.description: Optional ID given by the remote scheduler.
schedulerJobId.name: schedulerJobId

tenantQueue.description: Tenant queue to which job was assigned.
tenantQueue.name: tenantQueue

visible.description: User visibility of this job record.
visible.name: visible

workPath.description: The directory on the remote execution system from which the job is running.
workPath.name: workPath

remoteQueue.description: The queue to which this job should be submitted. This is optional and only applies when the execution system has a batch scheduler.
remoteQueue.name: remoteQueue

ended.description: The date the job stopped running due to termination, completion, or error in ISO 8601 format.
ended.name: ended

status.description: The status of the job. Possible values are: PENDING, STAGING_INPUTS, CLEANING_UP, ARCHIVING, STAGING_JOB, FINISHED, KILLED, FAILED, STOPPED, RUNNING, PAUSED, QUEUED, SUBMITTING, STAGED, PROCESSING_INPUTS, ARCHIVING_FINISHED, ARCHIVING_FAILED
status.name: status

systemId.description: The system id of the execution system.
systemId.name: systemId

started.description: The date the job started in ISO 8601 format.
started.name: started

appId.description: The unique name of the application being run by this job. This must be a valid application that the calling user has permission to run.
appId.name: appId

ended.description: The date the job ended in ISO 8601 format.
ended.name: ended

id.description: The unique id of the job.
id.name: id
